name: Slider
author: Leon Zhang
description: Polyfill on top of input type='range', providing a consistent UI regardless of whether type='range' is supported or not.

documentation.description: Polyfill on top of input type='range', providing a consistent UI regardless of whether type='range' is supported or not.

attributes.polyfill: If set, the input is 'replaced' with our polyfill slider's event handlers and graphics.
attributes.max: Sets the maximum of the slider's range
attributes.min: Sets the minimum of the slider's range
attributes.step: Sets the step value of the slider's range

events.change: Fired when the value of the slider changes
events.input: Fired the user attempts to change the value of the slider (such as with the mouse).
events.focus: Fired when the slider is focused on
events.blur: Fired when the slider loses focus

getters.inputElem: Returns the DOM element of the actual underlying <input> element
getters.max: Gets the maximum of the slider's range (as a number, not a string)
getters.min: Gets the minimum of the slider's range (as a number, not a string)
getters.step: Gets the step value of the slider's range (as a number, not a string)

setters.polyfill: If set, the input is 'replaced' with our polyfill slider's event handlers and graphics.
setters.max: Sets the maximum of the slider's range
setters.min: Sets the minimum of the slider's range
setters.step: Sets the step value of the slider's range
